main event: On 5 November 1956 in Bucyrus, Ohio, a ground-radar observation reported a round white object, the size of a dime at arm's length, with a light, moving back and forth at a low altitude heading northward for fifteen minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a dime at arm's length, indicating it was relatively small.
The duration of the observation was fifteen minutes, allowing for a detailed study of the object's movements.
The conclusion suggested that the sighting was probably caused by a balloon, indicating a prosaic explanation.
This observation was made using ground-radar, adding a technological aspect to the report.
The investigation showed that the object probably indicated a sighting caused by a balloon, pointing to a logical explanation.
sighted object: One round white object with a light
